com.google.appinventor.shared.rpc.project
Class ProjectNode

java.lang.Object
  com.google.appinventor.shared.rpc.project.ProjectNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
FileNode, FolderNode, ProjectRootNode
public abstract class ProjectNode
extends Object
implements Serializable

Project nodes are used for the structural representation of a project. This is the superclass for all project nodes.

The node can directly represent files or folders in the filesystem on the backend, as well as 'virtual' files or folders. An example for a virtual folder is a package node which maps to a series of nested folders.

Project nodes will be returned by the backend via RPC to the client in the browser. Therefore they must be serializable. If there are any fields that cannot be serialized, they must be marked as transient.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

ProjectNode

public ProjectNode()
Default constructor (for serialization only). Unfortunately this will prevent any fields from being marked as final!

ProjectNode

public ProjectNode(String name,
                   String fileId)
Creates a new project node.

Parameters:
name - project node name (can be different from file or folder represented by this node)
fileId - ID to identify the file/folder represented by the project node on the backend (can be null for 'virtual' folders)

getParent

public ProjectNode getParent()
Returns the project node's parent.

Returns:
parent project node (null for root node)

getProjectRoot

public ProjectRootNode getProjectRoot()
Returns the root project node for this project node. This method can be called on any project node within the project hierarchy.

Returns:
root node of the associated project

getProjectId

public long getProjectId()
Returns the ID of the project associated with this node. This method can be called on any project node within the project hierarchy.

Returns:
ID of the associated project

getProjectType

public String getProjectType()
Returns the project type of the nodes in this project (all nodes within a project share the same project type).

Note that ProjectRootNode subclasses need to override this method!

Returns:
type of the associated project

getName

public String getName()
Returns the name of this project node.

Returns:
name of this node (doesn't have to be the same as the name of the file/folder represented by this node)

Returns the full name of this project node.

Returns the ID for this project node.

iterable

protected boolean isSourceNode()
Indicates whether a node is a source node.

Returns:

Recursively collects all source nodes.

Parameters:

setName

public void setName(String newName)
Used to rename a node.

Note that this will not cause a rename in the storage system!

Parameters:
newName - new name
